meanings.sent1: The niggards in the story refused to share their food with anyone.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known in town as the biggest niggard when it came to charity.
meanings.sent3: The niggards at the office always brought the smallest portions to potluck lunches.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a niggard spread through the village like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The image of the niggard counting every penny was etched in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: To be overly cautious or hesitant in spending or giving.
meanings.sent1: She niggards her time so much that she misses out on all the fun activities.
meanings.sent2: He always niggards when it comes to buying new clothes, afraid to spend too much.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel niggards its acorns, hiding them in multiple places in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The student niggards his answers on the test, double-checking every detail.
meanings.sent5: The chef niggards the spices in his recipes, carefully measuring each one.
